meanings.definition: To glide in an airplane without engine power.
meanings.sent1: The pilot decided to volplane the aircraft down to the runway.
meanings.sent2: The bird seemed to volplane effortlessly through the sky.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could volplane to work instead of driving.
meanings.sent4: Her career seemed to volplane to success after years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The image of the glider volplaning down the mountain was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The paper airplane started to volplane gracefully across the room.
meanings.sent2: The skater could volplane across the ice with ease.
meanings.sent3: I watched the leaves volplane down from the tree in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to volplane over his head, leaving him confused.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements were so fluid, it looked like she could volplane through the air.

meanings.definition: A gliding descent of an airplane.
meanings.sent1: The volplane of the aircraft was smooth and controlled.
meanings.sent2: The pilot executed a perfect volplane to land the plane safely.
meanings.sent3: The passengers cheered as the airplane began its volplane towards the airport.
meanings.sent4: The volplane of the glider was a sight to behold against the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The graceful volplane of the seagull caught the attention of onlookers below.
